snippet: More than 100 people were wounded as blasts struck a variety of civilian, government and security targets in half a dozen provinces.
abstract: Series of bomb attacks sweep through Iraq, killing at least 20 people and wounding more than 100 others; there is no immediate claim of responsibility for any of blasts.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Christine Hauser from New York. Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from the Iraqi cities of Kirkuk, Babil and Mosul.

lead_paragraph: More than 100 people were wounded as blasts struck a variety of civilian, government and security targets in half a dozen provinces.

headline.seo: At Least 20 Killed in Attacks Throughout Iraq
headline.main: At Least 20 Die in Series of Bomb Attacks Throughout Iraq
headline.print_headline: At Least 20 Die in Series of Bomb Attacks Throughout Iraq
